columns.text: In this problem, we will calculate the quarterly payments to an athlete based on the proposed contract and the additional negotiated terms.

We will consider the following proposed salary arrangement by the team.

Additionally, as per the athlete terms, we assumed the following additional details from the contract:

| Particulars              |             |
|--------------------------|-------------|
| Signing Bonus            | $10,000,000 |
| Interest rate compounded daily           | 4.8%        |
| Contract value increase  | $2,000,000  |

First, let's get the effective annual rate of the interest rate compounded daily.

The Effective Annual Rate refers to a loan's annual interest rate after considering the nominal interest rate and the compounding of periods.

The EAR calculation considers the APR and the compounding period of a loan. Hence, we will consider the annual percentage rate we calculated from the previous steps. The EAR can be calculated using the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &=\left(1+\dfrac{APR}{m}\right)^m-1
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$EAR$, which means the effective annual rate\
$APR$, which refers to the annual percentage rate\
$m$, which refers to the compounding period

Since the 4.8% interest is daily compounded, the number of days in a year which is 365, will be the period. We will consider the rate equal to the interest rate divided by 365 in our calculation to determine the effective annual rate.

Let's now calculate the effective annual rate of the interest.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &=\left(1+\dfrac{0.0480}{12}\right)^{12}-1
\\[10pt]
 &=1.049167344-1
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{{4.92\%}}
\end{aligned}$$

Hence, the effective annual rate of interest is 4.92%.

Next, based on the projected six-year salary arrangement offered to the athlete and operating the effective annual rate as the appropriate discount rate, we will calculate the present value of the salary each year.

The present value refers to the current value of future cash flow, such as the projected salary of the athlete. It can be calculated by dividing the future value over the factor of the rate and period. Thus, the formula of present value is as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{PV} &=\dfrac{FV}{\left(1 + r\right)^{t}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$PV$, which denotes the present value\
$FV$, which refers to the future value\
$t$, which represent the period\
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

Considering the present value of the future cash flows calculated on the previous steps, combine all the present values and the initial salary of $8,400,000 at year 0 to calculate the net present value of the salaries. We will use the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{NPV of Salaries} &=\text{Initial salary}+{PV}_{1}+{PV}_{2}+{PV}_{3}+{PV}_{4}+{PV}_{5}+{PV}_{6}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$NPV$, which refers to the net present value\
$PV$, which indicates the present value

Let's now calculate the net present value of the salaries.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{NPV of Salaries} &=\$8,400,000 +\$4,479,604 
+\$4,632,907 +\$4,935,146 +\$5,281,373 +\$5,584,277+\$5,847,159 
\\[10pt]
&= \boxed{\$39,160,466}
\end{aligned}$$

Based on our calculation, the present value of the projected salaries is $39,160,466.

Let's now calculate the net present value of the contract.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Total NPV } &=\$39,160,466+\$2,000,000
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\bf\$41,160,466}
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the total net present value of the arrangement is $41,160,466.

Let's now compute the fund for quarterly payments.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{NPV for Quarterly payments} &=\$41,160,466-\$10,000,000
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\$31,160,466}
\end{aligned}$$

Hence, the net present value for quarterly distribution is $31,160,466.
Now that we have the amount for quarterly payment, we will determine the effective quarterly rate to proceed with the calculation of the quarterly payment.
Finally, considering the effective quarterly rate of the period and the present value of the contract less the signing bonus, we will calculate the quarterly payment to the athlete.

In calculating the quarterly payment to the athlete based on the contract, we will consider the following details:

| Particulars              |             |
|--------------------------|-------------|
| Effective quarterly rate            | 1.23% |
| NPV of the arrangement           | $31,160,466        |
| Period  | 24 (Quarters)  |

Note that the period is determined by multiplying the six years period of the contract by four, representing the number of quarters in a year. We will use the period quarterly since the payment is per quarter.

We will use a spreadsheet function called PMT to calculate the quarterly payment. 

The PMT function is a financial operation that can calculate the equal periodic payment of a loan or investment based on the rate, period, and present value.

The PMT function in spreadsheet can be use using the following equation:

$$\begin{aligned}
PMT&=(\text{rate},nper,pv,[fv],[type]) \\
\end{aligned}$$


Where:

$nper$, which refers to the period\
$pv$, which represent the present value\
$fv$, the future value\
$type$, which indicates the basis of the calculation, either year-end or beginning of the year

Let's now calculate the quarterly payment on a spreadsheet. Note that the present value should be negative for the formula to work correctly.

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/e01fab38-bbeb-497f-bb08-d9491c100885-1643219401188725.png)

**Our calculation shows that the quarterly payment the athlete can earn from the arrangement is $1,507,315.82.**

To conclude, after considering the present value of the proposed salary arrangement for the athlete and the additional contract value increase and signing bonus, the quarterly payment the athlete can receive is $1,507,315.82.
